NoteLiteral.En:
Entry requirements: 
•	Student at any of the universities of the ECIU;
•	B2 level of English language proficiency.
Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card / passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol in the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page).
Students, who are admitted and accepted the offered place in the micro-module, will be informed by email on the steps to take in order to gain access to the KTU virtual learning environment. Students will receive an email from the teacher of the micro-module on the first day of the start of module.
Students who have dropped out from the KTU micro-module(s) in the autumn 2024 are not eligible to enrol in the KTU micro-module(s) in the spring 2025.

Description.En: The Time Management Essentials micro-module provides you with skills necessary for navigating the demands of academic life. As students, you have to find a balance between numerous courses, their assignments, and extracurricular activities, thus, effective time management becomes of great importance. By learning to create realistic schedules and develop effective study habits, you can enhance your productivity and reduce stress. Moreover, these time management skills go beyond the academic realm and prepare you for the complexities of professional life.

NoteLiteral.En: The student will be able to create realistic and achievable schedules, utilizing various planning tools and methods.
The student will understand how to build and maintain good habits.

Title.En: Implement the principles of maintaining your energy

NoteLiteral.En: The student will be able to implement the principles of maintaining their energy.

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
To pass the micro-module, you must achieve a score of 50% or higher for each graded activity. The highest possible grade is 100%. When you complete all the required micro-module activities, you will earn a final grade.

The following activities will be graded: Discussion forum participation; Time-management improvement plan; Reflection.

The templates how to write your Time-Management Improvement Plan and Reflection will be provided.

The micro-module will last for six weeks. The first and the last weeks weeks will introduce and wrap up the micro-module. Other four weeks will focus on a different topic: Goal setting and prioritizing; Time-management strategies; The power of habits; Refueling your energy.

[Syllabus of the micro-module](https://uais.cr.ktu.lt/ktuis/stp_report_ects.mdl_ml?p_kodas=MM00M102&p_year=2024&p_lang=EN&p_stp_id=)

The micro-module will be delivered in the KTU virtual learning environment. When a student is enrolled in KTU, s/he will be informed by email on how to gain access to the micro-module.  

After the successful completion of the micro-module:

- In two weeks, a student will receive an email with the link to download the ECIU University micro-credential.
- In mid-June 2025, a student from other university than KTU will receive an email with the KTU Transcript of Records that might be presented for recognition of learning outcomes at the home university.
Own your time to enhance efficiency and fulfilment

This micro-module provides you with practical strategies to prioritize tasks, set realistic goals, and allocate your time efficiently. In a world where efficient use of time is highly valued, the Time Management Essentials micro-module becomes an indispensable tool in fostering success both at university and in future career.

Entry requirements:

- Student at any of the universities of the ECIU;
- B2 level of English language proficiency.

Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card / passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol in the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page).

Students, who are admitted and accepted the offered place in the micro-module, will be informed by email on the steps to take in order to gain access to the KTU virtual learning environment. Students will receive an email from the teacher of the micro-module on the first day of the start of module.

Students who have dropped out from the KTU micro-module(s) in the autumn 2024 are not eligible to enrol in the KTU micro-module(s) in the spring 2025.
